comments:
I'm unable to get an Eclipse InfoCenter running with Tomcat 4.0.3 on
Windows 2002 server. I'm following the instructions for the Ecplise V2
InfoCenter with the 2.0 Eclipse Release build, as provided here --
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/platform-help-
home/infocenter.html

I have the following:
- j2sdk1.4.0_01
- jakarta-tomcat-4.0.3
- Eclipse V2 (build dated 6/27/2002 6:47 pm)
- Updated \jakarta-tomcat-4.0.3\conf\server.xml to include the context path for 
help.
- Updated \jakarta-tomcat-4.0.3\bin\setclasspath.bat to add the new CLASSPATH 
and JAVA_OPTS settings.
- Removed \jakarta-tomcat-4.0.3\common\lib\xerces.jar.

I get the following result:

Apache Tomcat/4.0.3 - HTTP Status 500 - Internal Server Error

John, please download the infocenter and the eclipse drivers from the eclipse 
download page.
Pick up the latest integration build, and notice the infocenter download link 
and instructions at the bottom of that page.

I notice you are running Windows 2002 server, which I do not think is a 
platform supported by Eclipse.  Upon installation of Eclipse, can you start 
eclipse.exe and verify that this at least works?

It is reccommended that you move to Eclipse 2.0.1, if you are having problems 
with 2.0, but before you do, can you check if D:\jakarta-tomcat-4.0.3
\work\localhost\help\.metadata\.log file exists.  There might be more error 
information in it.

John, I assume you've solved the problem, so I'll close the bug.
Please use the 2.0.2 or the 2.1 infocenters, and if they still don't work, feel 
free to re-open the bug. Thanks.
